channel.title: Tracks on Open Security Summit
channel.description: Recent content in Tracks on Open Security Summit

item.title: Lessons from the Legion
item.description: IT/Security Industry Challenges, how can we become better at our game? For a relatively fast, dense, noisy introduction, please see https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=516Z420BgkE from OWASP BeNeLux 2018. It can seem that the cyber security industry has evolved ways of working, and preferences in solutions and methods, as a series of point solutions that have become accepted traditions / rituals, rather than as a collective effort at forward thinking. A vendor-led industry mainly driven by technical experts may have come up with the best overall strategies to solve the incredibly complex problems of cyber security, but it doesn't feel that way.

item.title: OWASP Juice Shop (Keynote)
item.description: Bjoern will introduce to us the OWASP Juice Shop, probably the most modern and sophisticated insecure web application

item.title: OWASP SAMM v2
item.description: Update on the new version 2.0 of SAMM

item.title: OWASP ZAP Heads Up Display (HUD)
item.description: Demonstration of the new OWASP ZAP Heads Up Display (HUD) by Simon

item.title: The Cynefin framework
item.description: Dave presenting the Cynefin framework, a conceptual framework used to aid decision-making

item.title: The Mobile Security Testing Guide (MSTG)
item.description: The MSTG team is working hard on the new release of the Mobile Security Testing Guide (MSTG) during this summit.

item.title: The OWASP Top Ten Proactive Controls 2018
item.description: Jim will cover the OWASP Top Ten Proactive Controls 2018, a list of security techniques that should be included in every software development project

item.title: Wardley maps
item.description: Simon presenting Wardley maps, and the use of topographical intelligence in business strategy
